name: home
trans: n. 家，住宅；产地；家乡；避难所
adj. 国内的，家庭的；有效的

sentences.english: They have a beautiful home in California.
sentences.chinese: 他们在加州有个美丽的家。

sentences.english: Good luck in your new home!
sentences.chinese: 祝你在新家一切顺利！

sentences.english: A family of birds made their home (= started living ) under the roof.
sentences.chinese: 一窝鸟在屋顶下安了家。

sentences.english: These children need a proper home life.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子需要正常的家庭生活。

detailed_translations.english: the house, apartment, or place where you live
relating to or belonging to your home or family

name: time
trans: n. 时间；时代；次数；节拍；倍数
adj. 定时的；定期的；分期的
vt. 计时；测定…的时间；安排…的速度

sentences.english: Einstein changed the way we think about space and time.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦改变了我们的时空概念。

sentences.english: close relationships established over a long period of time
sentences.chinese: 长期建立起来的亲密关系

sentences.english: Customers have only a limited amount of time to examine the goods.
sentences.chinese: 顾客只有有限的时间可以检查商品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时间；时代；次数；节拍；倍数
detailed_translations.english: the thing that is measured in minutes, hours, days, years etc using clocks

detailed_translations.chinese: 计时；测定…的时间；安排…的速度
detailed_translations.english: to arrange that something should happen at a particular time

sentences.english: I heard the clock strike six (= make six loud sounds ) .
sentences.chinese: 我听到钟敲了六下。

sentences.english: The station clock was ten minutes slow (= showed a time ten minutes earlier than the real time ) .
sentences.chinese: 车站的钟慢了十分钟。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that shows what time it is, in a room or outside on a building

name: house
trans: n. 住宅；家庭；机构；议会；某种用途的建筑物
vt. 覆盖；给…房子住；把…储藏在房内

sentences.english: a four-bedroom house
sentences.chinese: 一幢有四间卧室的房子

sentences.english: America’s oldest publishing house
sentences.chinese: 美国历史最悠久的出版社

sentences.english: a small independent software house
sentences.chinese: 一家小型的独立软件公司

sentences.english: an auction house
sentences.chinese: 一家拍卖行

sentences.english: a famous Italian fashion house
sentences.chinese: 一家著名的意大利时装公司

detailed_translations.english: a building that someone lives in, especially one that has more than one level and is intended to be used by one family

name: study
trans: n. 学习，研究；课题；书房；学问
vt. 学习；考虑；攻读；细察

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

name: kitchen
trans: n. 厨房；炊具；炊事人员

sentences.english: Sam went into the kitchen to make a pot of tea.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆走进厨房去沏一壶茶。

sentences.english: She is in the kitchen making a meal.
sentences.chinese: 她在厨房里做饭。

detailed_translations.english: the room where you prepare and cook food

name: toilet
trans: n. 厕所，盥洗室；梳妆，打扮

sentences.english: public toilets
sentences.chinese: 公共厕所

detailed_translations.english: a room or building containing a toilet

name: floor
trans: n. 地板，地面；楼层；基底；议员席
vt. 铺地板；打倒，击倒；（被困难）难倒

sentences.english: a polished wooden floor
sentences.chinese: 上过蜡的木地板

sentences.english: a puddle of water on the kitchen floor
sentences.chinese: 厨房地面上的一摊水

sentences.english: a warehouse that has 410,000 square feet of floor space
sentences.chinese: 楼面面积为41万平方英尺的仓库

detailed_translations.chinese: 地板，地面；楼层；基底；议员席
detailed_translations.english: the flat surface that you stand on inside a building

detailed_translations.chinese: 铺地板；打倒，击倒；（被困难）难倒
detailed_translations.english: to hit someone so hard that they fall down

name: there
trans: adv. 在那里；在那边；在那点上

sentences.english: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以回到我的小屋去吃午饭。

sentences.english: Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰？我一直想去那儿。

sentences.english: Hold it right there and don’t move.
sentences.chinese: 就站在那里，不要动。

sentences.english: Can you pass me that wine glass there?
sentences.chinese: 你能把那个葡萄酒杯递给我吗？

sentences.english: Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.
sentences.chinese: 看，那就是我跟你说过的那家书店。

sentences.english: Who’s that man over there ?
sentences.chinese: 那边的那个男人是谁？

sentences.english: It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.
sentences.chinese: 一天开车来回太远了。

sentences.english: Are we going to get there (= arrive ) before the banks close?
sentences.chinese: 银行关门之前，我们到得了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 在那里；在那边；在那点上
detailed_translations.english: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do

sentences.english: We had bacon and eggs for breakfast .
sentences.chinese: 我们早餐吃了熏肉鸡蛋。

sentences.english: I never eat breakfast .
sentences.chinese: 我从来不吃早饭。

sentences.english: After a hearty breakfast (=  large breakfast  ) , we set out for a hike.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃了一顿丰盛的早餐，然后出发去远足了。

sentences.english: a light breakfast
sentences.chinese: 简单的早餐

sentences.english: a working breakfast
sentences.chinese: 工作早餐

detailed_translations.english: the meal you have in the morning

sentences.english: The food was served on long tables.
sentences.chinese: 食物放在长餐桌上供应。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture with a flat top supported by legs
to leave a bill etc to be discussed or dealt with in the future

name: put
trans: vt. 放；表达；移动；安置；赋予

sentences.english: He put the coffee on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他把咖啡放在桌上。

sentences.english: Where did you put the programmes?
sentences.chinese: 你把节目单放在哪里了？

detailed_translations.english: to move something to a particular place or position, especially using your hands

name: half
trans: adj. 一半的；不完全的；半途的

sentences.english: Two halves make a whole.
sentences.chinese: 两个一半构成一个整体。

sentences.english: Only half the guests had arrived by seven o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 7点钟前只来了一半客人。

sentences.english: If you look at our members, at least half are women.
sentences.chinese: 看看我们的会员，至少有一半是女性。

sentences.english: ...a half measure of fresh lemon juice.
sentences.chinese: …半量杯的新鲜柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: one of two equal parts of something
exactly or about 50% (1/2) of an amount, time, distance, number etc

name: dinner
trans: n. 晚餐，晚宴；宴会；正餐

sentences.english: What time do you usually have dinner?
sentences.chinese: 你通常什么时候吃饭？

sentences.english: We’re having fish for dinner tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天晚饭吃鱼。

sentences.english: What’s for dinner?
sentences.chinese: 晚饭吃什么？

sentences.english: the Club’s annual dinner
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的年度晚宴

detailed_translations.english: the main meal of the day, eaten in the middle of the day or the evening

name: dirty
trans: adj. 下流的，卑鄙的；肮脏的；恶劣的；暗淡的

sentences.english: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子

sentences.english: How did you get so dirty?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

sentences.english: kids telling dirty jokes
sentences.chinese: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人

sentences.english: a dirty magazine
sentences.chinese: 色情杂志

detailed_translations.english: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

sentences.english: What’s for lunch?
sentences.chinese: 午饭吃什么？

detailed_translations.english: a meal eaten in the middle of the day

name: me
trans: n. 自我；极端自私的人；自我的一部分

sentences.english: Stop, you’re hurting me.
sentences.chinese: 住手，你弄疼我了。

sentences.english: He bought me a drink.
sentences.chinese: 他给我买了一杯酒。

sentences.english: Give that book to me.
sentences.chinese: 把那本书给我。

sentences.english: She’s two years older than me.
sentences.chinese: 她比我大两岁。

sentences.english: That’s me, standing on the left.
sentences.chinese: 那是我，站在左边的那一个。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

sentences.english: I moved to this city six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前我搬到了这个城市。

sentences.english: I’m not late again, am I?
sentences.chinese: 我没有又迟到吧？

sentences.english: My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫喜欢去剧院看戏。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

sentences.english: Are you in love with him?
sentences.chinese: 你爱上他了吗？

sentences.english: Why don’t you ask him yourself?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不自己问他？

sentences.english: He repeated what she had told him.
sentences.chinese: 他把她告诉他的话重复了一遍。

sentences.english: I knew it was him as soon as I heard his voice.
sentences.chinese: 我一听声音就知道是他。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

name: he
trans: n. 男孩，男人；它（雄性动物）

sentences.english: ‘Where’s Paul?’ ‘He’s gone to the cinema.’
sentences.chinese: “保罗在哪儿？”“他去看电影了。”

sentences.english: It was he who first suggested the idea.
sentences.chinese: 是他先提出这个想法的。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.english: Employees must show their identity cards at the gate.
sentences.chinese: 雇员在大门口必须出示自己的身份卡。

sentences.english: I haven’t got my membership card yet.
sentences.chinese: 我还没拿到会员卡。

sentences.english: a piece of card
sentences.chinese: 一张卡片纸

sentences.english: My name’s Adam Carver. Here’s my card.
sentences.chinese: 我叫亚当•卡弗，这是我的名片。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc

sentences.english: Has anyone seen my keys? I can’t find them anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 有人见到我的钥匙吗？我哪儿都找不到。

sentences.english: The police were very helpful when I spoke to them.
sentences.chinese: 我和警察说了，他们很帮忙。

sentences.english: I lent him several books, but he hasn’t read any of them.
sentences.chinese: 我借给他几本书，但他一本还没看过。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about
used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘him or her’

sentences.english: Bob and Sue said they wouldn’t be able to come.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃和休说他们来不了。

sentences.english: Ken gave me some flowers. Aren’t they beautiful?
sentences.chinese: 肯送给我一些花。很漂亮吧？

sentences.english: They all want to come to the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 他们都想来参加婚礼。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about

sentences.english: ...Mr. Grant.
sentences.chinese: …格兰特先生。

sentences.english: ...Mr. Bob Price.
sentences.chinese: …鲍勃·普赖斯先生。

detailed_translations.english: Mr. is used before a man's name when you are speaking or referring to him

sentences.english: Hello, Mrs. Miles.
sentences.chinese: 你好，迈尔斯夫人。

sentences.english: ...Mrs. Anne Pritchard.
sentences.chinese: …安妮·普里查德太太。

detailed_translations.chinese: (女子的姓氏或姓名前)太太；夫人
detailed_translations.english: Mrs. is used before the name of a married woman when you are speaking or referring to her

name: umbrella
trans: n. 雨伞；保护伞；庇护；伞形结构

sentences.english: It started to rain, so Tricia stopped to put up her umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 开始下雨了，所以特里西娅停下来撑起雨伞。

sentences.english: I spent the day on the beach, lying under a beach umbrella, reading.
sentences.chinese: 那天我就在海滩上度过，躺在海滩遮阳伞下面看书。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雨伞；保护伞；庇护；伞形结构
detailed_translations.english: an object that you use to protect yourself against rain or hot sun. It consists of a circular folding frame covered in cloth.

sentences.english: ...Ms. Brown.
sentences.chinese: …布朗女士。

detailed_translations.chinese: (于女子的姓名前，不指明婚否)女士
detailed_translations.english: Ms. is used, especially in written English, before a woman's name when you are speaking to her or referring to her. If you use Ms., you are not specifying if the woman is married or not.

name: driver
trans: n. 驾驶员；驱动程序；起子；传动器

sentences.english: a taxi driver
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机

sentences.english: Do you think you’re a good driver?
sentences.chinese: 你认为自己是个好司机吗？

detailed_translations.english: someone who drives a car, bus etc

name: well
trans: adj. 良好的；健康的；适宜的
adv. 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: James reads quite well for his age.
sentences.chinese: 就詹姆斯的年龄来说，他的阅读能力算不错了。

sentences.english: All the team played very well today.
sentences.chinese: 今天所有队员都打得很不错。

sentences.english: Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
sentences.chinese: 有压力时西蒙的工作表现就不好。

sentences.english: The festival was very well organized.
sentences.chinese: 节庆活动组织得很好。

sentences.english: The concert went very well.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地
detailed_translations.english: in a successful or satisfactory way
healthy

name: class
trans: n. 阶级；班级；种类；班；等级
adj. 极好的；很好的，优秀的，出色的

sentences.english: Gary came top of the class in English.
sentences.chinese: 加里的英文是班里顶尖的。

sentences.english: a member of the landed class
sentences.chinese: 地主阶级的一员

sentences.english: He’s not in the same class (= not as good ) as her at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 他的网球水平并不如她。

detailed_translations.english: a group of students who are taught together

name: ill
trans: adj. 生病的；坏的；邪恶的；不吉利的
adv. 不利地；恶劣地；几乎不

sentences.english: Bridget can’t come – she’s ill.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特不能来了，她生病了。

sentences.english: He was unable to join the army because of ill health.
sentences.chinese: 他因为身体不好没法参军。

sentences.english: The animals had been grossly ill-treated.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物受到了恣意虐待。

detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or not feeling well
badly or in an unpleasant way

sentences.english: piano lessons
sentences.chinese: 钢琴课

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in which someone is taught a particular skill, for example how to play a musical instrument or drive a car

sentences.english: He emphasized its importance to me.
sentences.chinese: 他向我强调它的重要性。

sentences.english: The child read the story but did not comprehend its meaning.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子读了这篇故事，但不能理解它的意思。

sentences.english: The company disseminated information about its new programmes.
sentences.chinese: 公司传播有关其新计划的信息。

name: word
trans: n. [语] 单词；话语；消息；诺言；命令

sentences.english: Write an essay of about five hundred words.
sentences.chinese: 写一篇约500字的文章。

sentences.english: What does that word mean?
sentences.chinese: 那个单词是什么意思？

sentences.english: ‘Vater’ is the German word for (= that means ) ‘father’.
sentences.chinese: vater在德语中是“父亲”的意思。

sentences.english: Perhaps ‘lucky’ is not exactly the right word .
sentences.chinese: 也许“幸运”一词还不够贴切。

detailed_translations.chinese: [语] 单词；话语；消息；诺言；命令
detailed_translations.english: a single group of letters that are used together with a particular meaning
to use words that are carefully chosen in order to express something

name: always
trans: adv. 永远，一直；总是；常常

sentences.english: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
sentences.chinese: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。

sentences.english: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
sentences.chinese: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。

sentences.english: He hadn’t always been a butler.
sentences.chinese: 他并不是一直当管家。

sentences.english: I’ll always remember that day.
sentences.chinese: 我会永远记住那一天。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, at all times, or every time

sentences.english: I sometimes have to work late.
sentences.chinese: 我有时得工作到很晚。

sentences.english: Sometimes, Grandma would tell us stories about her childhood in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，祖母会跟我们讲讲她儿时在意大利的经历。

sentences.english: ‘Do you ever wish you were back in Japan?’ ‘Sometimes. Not very often.’
sentences.chinese: “你有没有想过希望回到日本？”“有时候吧，但不经常这么想。”

sentences.english: The journey takes an hour, sometimes even longer.
sentences.chinese: 路上需要一小时，有时甚至更长。

detailed_translations.english: on some occasions but not always

sentences.english: the effect on plants as the seasons start to change
sentences.chinese: 换季对植物的影响

detailed_translations.english: one of the main periods into which a year is divided, each of which has a particular type of weather. The seasons are spring, summer, autumn, and winter
to add salt, pepper etc to food you are cooking

name: spring
trans: n. 春天；弹簧；泉水；活力；跳跃
vt. 使跳起；使爆炸；突然提出；使弹开
vi. 生长；涌出；跃出；裂开

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

sentences.english: We tour by car every summer.
sentences.chinese: 每年夏天我们都驾车出外旅行。

sentences.english: Food must be refrigerated in summer.
sentences.chinese: 食物在夏天必须加以冷藏。

sentences.english: After a summer here the poorest sheep and cattle grow strong and fat.
sentences.chinese: 经过一个夏天， 连最差的牛羊在这里也长得又肥又壮了。

name: autumn
trans: n. 秋天；成熟期；渐衰期，凋落期

sentences.english: autumn mists
sentences.chinese: 秋天的雾霭

detailed_translations.english: the season between summer and winter, when leaves change colour and the weather becomes cooler

sentences.english: I like winter because we play soccer!
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢冬天因为我们踢足球！

sentences.english: Well, the worst of the winter should be over.
sentences.chinese: 不过，冬天最糟糕的一段日子总该过去了。

sentences.english: Do you like summer? Yes, but I like winter better.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢夏天吗？是的，但是我更喜欢冬天。

detailed_translations.english: the season after autumn and before spring, when the weather is coldest

sentences.english: I can eat what I want but I never put on weight.
sentences.chinese: 我想吃什么就能吃什么，而体重从不增加。

detailed_translations.english: If someone puts on weight, they become heavier

name: take off
trans: v. (飞机)起飞；出去；拿掉；移送

sentences.english: We eventually took off at 11 o'clock and arrived in Juneau at 1:30.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于在11点起飞，1:30到达朱诺。

sentences.english: He took off at once and headed back to the motel.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地立刻就离开了，然后回到了那家汽车旅馆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义:（飞机等）起飞；匆忙离开
detailed_translations.english: When an aeroplane takes off, it leaves the ground and starts flying

name: again
trans: adv. 又，此外；再一次；再说；增加

sentences.english: Can you say that again? I didn’t hear.
sentences.chinese: 你能再说一遍吗？ 我没听见。

sentences.english: I’ll never go there again.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不会去那儿了。

sentences.english: Mr Khan’s busy. Can you try again later?
sentences.chinese: 卡恩先生正忙着。 你能不能过一会儿再打来？

sentences.english: In 1997, the family moved house yet again.
sentences.chinese: 1997年，全家人再一次搬家。

sentences.english: And again, these workshops will benefit the community widely.
sentences.chinese: 再说，这些工作坊会令社区很多人受惠。

detailed_translations.english: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before

name: body
trans: n. 身体；主体；大量；团体；主要部分

sentences.english: the human body
sentences.chinese: 人体

sentences.english: My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
sentences.chinese: 我手指麻木，浑身疼痛。

sentences.english: He needs to overcome a negative body image (=  what you think about your own body  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他需要克服对自己身体的负面印象。

sentences.english: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 一条狗在树林里发现了一具女孩的尸体。

sentences.english: the main body of the text
sentences.chinese: 课文的正文

detailed_translations.english: the physical structure of a person or animal

name: nose
trans: n. 鼻子；嗅觉；突出的部分；探问
vi. 小心探索着前进；探问

sentences.english: Someone punched him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

name: mouth
trans: vt. 做作地说，装腔作势地说；喃喃地说出

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他把玻璃杯举到嘴边。

sentences.english: Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

name: head
trans: n. 头；头痛；上端；最前的部分；理解力
adj. 头的；主要的；在顶端的
vt. 前进；用头顶；作为…的首领；站在…的前头；给…加标题
vi. 出发；成头状物；船驶往

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的头顶。

sentences.english: Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们一头跳进水中。

sentences.english: She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
sentences.chinese: 他依然满头浓发。

sentences.english: Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc

sentences.english: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

detailed_translations.english: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

name: arm
trans: n. 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
sentences.chinese: 戴夫手臂断了。

sentences.english: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞书。

sentences.english: They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
sentences.chinese: 双腿干瘦的小男孩

sentences.english: She fell and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔断了腿。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

name: eye
trans: n. 眼睛；视力；眼光；见解，观点

sentences.english: He’s got beautiful eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他有一双漂亮的眼睛。

sentences.english: There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.chinese: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.english: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.chinese: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

name: think
trans: vt. 想；认为；想起；想像；打算

sentences.english: I thought I heard something.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我听到了什么声音。

sentences.english: He didn’t think anyone would believe him.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得没人会相信他。

sentences.english: Do you think I should call him?
sentences.chinese: 你认为我应该打电话给他吗？

sentences.english: For some reason, I keep thinking it’s Friday today.
sentences.chinese: 不知为什么，我总觉得今天是周五。

sentences.english: The recession lasted longer than anyone thought it would.
sentences.chinese: 谁也没有想到这次经济萧条会持续这么久。

sentences.english: Am I right in thinking that you have a brother?
sentences.chinese: 我想你是有个兄弟的，对吗？

sentences.english: I can’t help thinking that he’s made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我总觉得他弄错了。

sentences.english: Do you honestly think I would do something so stupid?
sentences.chinese: 你真认为我会做这么愚蠢的事吗？

sentences.english: We must start thinking in terms of reducing costs.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须开始考虑降低成本了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular opinion or to believe that something is true
to think about a problem or question

name: can
trans: aux. 能； 能够； 可以； 可能
n. 罐头； （用金属或塑料制作的）容器； （马口铁或其他金属制作的）食品罐头
vt. 将…装入密封罐中保存

sentences.english: ...fruits and vegetables that will be canned, skinned, diced, or otherwise processed.
sentences.chinese: …将要经过装罐、去皮、切块或其他加工程序的水果和蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

sentences.english: By the time she was eight, she could read Greek and Latin.
sentences.chinese: 她八岁时就会读希腊文和拉丁文了。

detailed_translations.english: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past

sentences.english: Why are you crying?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么哭？

sentences.english: Why do we have to take all these tests?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么一定要参加这些测验？

sentences.english: ‘She wants to meet you.’ ‘Why?’
sentences.chinese: “她想认识你。”“为什么？”

sentences.english: ‘I won’t be able to come into work tomorrow.’ ‘Why not?’
sentences.chinese: “我明天不能来上班。”“为什么？”

sentences.english: I have no idea why the television isn’t working.
sentences.chinese: 我不明白电视机为什么坏了。

sentences.english: Simon loves you – that’s why he wants to be with you.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙爱你——所以他想和你在一起。

sentences.english: He’s angry with me and I don’t know why.
sentences.chinese: 他生我气了，我不知道为什么。

sentences.english: There’s no reason why we shouldn’t be friends.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有理由不成为朋友。

detailed_translations.english: used to ask or talk about the reason for something
used when you are surprised or have suddenly realized something

sentences.english: The school holidays start tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 学校假期从明天开始。

sentences.english: a national holiday
sentences.chinese: 全国假日

detailed_translations.english: a time of rest from work, school etc

name: bring
trans: vt. 带来；促使；引起；使某人处于某种情况或境地

sentences.english: Did you bring an umbrella?
sentences.chinese: 你带伞了吗？

sentences.english: The senator’s speech brought an angry response from Civil Rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 那名参议员的话引起了一些民权组织的愤怒。

sentences.english: The discovery of gold brought thousands of people to the Transvaal.
sentences.chinese: 黄金的发现把成千上万的人引到了德兰士瓦。

detailed_translations.english: to take something or someone with you to the place where you are now, or to the place you are talking about

name: give
trans: vi. 捐赠；面向；有弹性；气候转暖
vt. 给；产生；让步；举办；授予

sentences.english: Researchers were given a £10,000 grant to continue their work.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员得到一万英镑的经费以继续他们的研究。

sentences.english: I’ve got some old diaries that my grandmother gave me years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我有几本旧日记本，是多年前祖母给我的。

sentences.english: I didn’t steal it! Maria gave it to me!
sentences.chinese: 我不是偷的！是玛丽亚给我的！

sentences.english: Most people are willing to give to charity .
sentences.chinese: 大多数人都愿意向慈善事业捐款。

sentences.english: The situation is now desperate, so please give generously .
sentences.chinese: 现在情况危急，请大家慷慨解囊。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have something as a present, or to provide something for someone

name: song
trans: n. 歌曲；歌唱；诗歌；鸣声

sentences.english: We used to listen to pop songs on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 我们以前常常听收音机里播放的流行歌曲。

sentences.english: They sat round with guitars, singing folk songs.
sentences.chinese: 他们弹着吉他围坐在一起唱民歌。

sentences.english: ...dance, music, mime, and song.
sentences.chinese: …舞蹈、音乐、哑剧和歌唱。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of music with words that you sing

sentences.english: I’ll see you at tomorrow’s meeting.
sentences.chinese: 明天会上见。

detailed_translations.english: the day after today
on or during the day after today

name: then
trans: adv. 然后；那么；于是；当时；此外

sentences.english: I wish I had known then what I know now.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望那时我就知道现在所知道的一切。

sentences.english: It was then that I realised she’d tricked me.
sentences.chinese: 直到那时我才知道她骗了我。

sentences.english: He started his career in St Petersburg – or Leningrad as it then was.
sentences.chinese: 他在圣彼得堡——当时叫列宁格勒——开始他的事业。

sentences.english: They met in 1942 and from then on (= starting at that time ) they were firm friends.
sentences.chinese: 他们1942年认识，从那时起就一直是好朋友。

sentences.english: Silently she closed the door. Just then she heard a noise.
sentences.chinese: 她默不作声地关上了门。 就在那时，她听到有声响。

sentences.english: I was paid £1,000, which was a lot of money back then (= a long time ago when things were different ) in the 1950s.
sentences.chinese: 他们给了我1,000英镑，在20世纪50年代那可是一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 然后；那么；于是；当时；此外
detailed_translations.english: at a particular time in the past or future

name: put up
trans: 提供；建造；举起；提高；推举，提名；供给…住宿；直接行动

sentences.english: They're putting new street signs up.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在张贴新的路标。

detailed_translations.english: If you put up a poster or notice, you attach it to a wall or board

name: open
trans: adj. 公开的；敞开的；空旷的；坦率的；营业着的

sentences.english: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.english: an open window
sentences.chinese: 打开的窗户

sentences.english: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.chinese: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.english: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.english: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.chinese: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.english: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.chinese: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.english: Jack opened the window.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开窗户。

detailed_translations.english: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

name: little
trans: adj. 小的；很少的；短暂的；小巧可爱的
n. 少许；没有多少；短时间

sentences.english: a little house
sentences.chinese: 小屋

sentences.english: a cake decorated with little flowers
sentences.chinese: 点缀着小花的蛋糕

sentences.english: She was cutting the meat up into little bits.
sentences.chinese: 她把肉切成小丁。

sentences.english: Let me tell you a little bit about myself.
sentences.chinese: 我来给你稍微讲讲我自己吧。

sentences.english: We didn’t have toys like this when I was little.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，我们没有这样的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: small in size
